interface.name: org_kde_kwin_fake_input
interface.description:
This interface allows other processes to provide fake input events. Purpose is on the one hand side to provide testing facilities like XTest on X11. But also to support use case like kdeconnect's mouse pad interface.
A compositor should not trust the input received from this interface. Clients should not expect that the compositor honors the requests from this interface.

request.name: authenticate

description.summary: Information why the client wants to use the interface

request.description: A client should use this request to tell the compositor why it wants to use this interface. The compositor might use the information to decide whether it wants to grant the request. The data might also be passed to the user to decide whether the application should get granted access to this very privileged interface.

arg.name: application
arg.summary: user visible name of the application

arg.name: reason
arg.summary: reason why the application wants to use this interface

request.name: touch_down
request.description: A client should use this request to send touch down event at specific coordinates.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: unique id for touch down event

arg.name: x
arg.summary: x coordinate for touch down event

arg.name: y
arg.summary: y coordinate for touch down event

request.name: touch_motion
request.description: A client should use this request to send touch motion to specific position.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: unique id for touch motion event

arg.name: x
arg.summary: x coordinate for touch motion event

arg.name: y
arg.summary: y coordinate for touch motion event

request.name: touch_up
request.description: A client should use this request to send touch up event.

arg.name: id
arg.summary: unique id for touch up event

request.name: touch_cancel
request.description: A client should use this request to cancel the current touch event.

request.name: touch_frame
request.description: A client should use this request to send touch frame event.
